verse: [Finally; or Now then; Furthermore] Brothers and sisters, we taught you how to ·live [walk] in a way that will please God, and you are living that way. Now we ask and ·encourage [urge; appeal to] you in the Lord Jesus to ·live that way [excel; abound] even more.
[For] You know what ·we told [instructions/commands we gave] you to do ·by the authority of [through] the Lord Jesus.
·God wants you to be holy and [or For this is God’s will, your sanctification:] to stay away from sexual sins.
He wants each of you to ·learn to control your own body [or take a wife for yourself; or live with your own wife; gain/possess his own vessel] in a way that is holy and honorable.
·Don’t use your body for sexual sin […not in lustful passion] like the ·people [Gentiles] who do not know God.

Also, do not ·wrong [exploit; transgress] or ·cheat [take advantage of] another ·Christian [brother (or sister)] in this way. The Lord ·will punish people who do those [is the avenger concerning these] things as we have already told you and ·warned [solemnly testified to] you.
[For] God did not call us to ·a life of sin [impurity], but to holiness.

·So [Therefore] the person who ·refuses to obey [disregards; rejects; despises] this teaching is not simply ·disobeying [disregarding; rejecting; despising] ·a human being [human authority], but God, who gives you his Holy Spirit.
We do not need to write you about ·having love for your Christian family [brotherly love], because God has already taught you to love each other.
And truly you do love the ·Christians [brothers (and sisters)] in all of Macedonia [1:7]. Now we encourage you, brothers and sisters, to ·love them [excel; abound; v. 1] even more.

·Do all you can […and to aspire] to live a peaceful life. ·Take care of [Attend to; Mind] your own business, and ·do your own work [work with your hands] as we have already ·told [instructed; commanded] you.
If you do, then you will ·win the respect of [or live a respectable/proper life before] ·unbelievers [outsiders], and you will not have to depend on others for what you need.

Brothers and sisters, we ·want you to know [do not want you to be uninformed] about those ·Christians who have died [who sleep; a euphemism for death] so you will not ·be sad [grieve], as ·others [the rest] who have no hope.
[For] We believe that Jesus died and that he rose again. ·So, through him, God will raise with Jesus those who have died [or So God will bring with Jesus those who have died/fallen asleep in him].

What we tell you now is ·the Lord’s own message [by the word of the Lord]. We who are ·living [still alive] when the Lord comes again will [certainly; surely] not go before those who have ·already died [fallen asleep].

The Lord himself will come down from heaven with a loud ·command [or shout], ·with [or accompanied by; or preceded by] the voice of the archangel [a leading or ruling angel; Dan. 10:13; Jude 9], and with the trumpet call of God. And ·those who have died believing [the dead] in Christ will rise first [1 Cor. 15:51–57].

After that, we who are ·still alive [or alive and are left] will be ·gathered [caught; taken] up with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And [so; in this way] we will be with the Lord forever.
So ·encourage [comfort] each other with these words.
